_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The definition of the world or what is k: Where there is the eye, sights, eye consciousness, and phenomena to be known by eye consciousness
Where there is the ear, sounds, ear consciousness, and phenomena to be known by ear consciousness
Where there is the nose, smells, nose consciousness, and phenomena to be known by nose consciousness
Where there is the tongue, tastes, tongue consciousness, and phenomena to be known by tongue consciousness
Where there is the body, touches, body consciousness, and phenomena to be known by body consciousness
Where there is the mind, thoughts, mind consciousness, and phenomena to be known by mind consciousness
The absence of the world or what is know: Where there is no eye, no sights, no eye consciousness, and no phenomena to be known by eye consciousness
Where there is no ear, no sounds, no ear consciousness, and no phenomena to be known by ear consciousness
Where there is no nose, no smells, no nose consciousness, and no phenomena to be known by nose consciousness
Where there is no tongue, no tastes, no tongue consciousness, and no phenomena to be known by tongue consciousness
Where there is no body, no touches, no body consciousness, and no phenomena to be known by body consciousness
Where there is no mind, no thoughts, no mind consciousness, and no phenomena to be known by mind consciousness.
